title: Maven `go-offline` goal fails in multi-module builds
body:
### Describe the bug

In order to improve build performance in our CI builds we want to use the Quarkus Maven plugin's `go-offline` goal in order to populate a local Maven repo which can then be shared by the builds. We tend to have multi-module projects and in this setup the Maven goal often fails, even though when the goal is executed for the Maven module, where it reported the failure, then the build is successful. See _Actual behavior_ for more details.

### Expected behavior

_No response_

### Actual behavior

If I in the Quarkus repo itself issue the command `./mvnw io.quarkus:quarkus-maven-plugin::go-offline -f integration-tests/` then I get the following exception:
```
[ERROR] Failed to execute goal io.quarkus:quarkus-maven-plugin:999-SNAPSHOT:go-offline (default-cli) on project quarkus-integration-test-avro-reload: Failed to resolve Quarkus application model for io.quarkus:quarkus-integration-test-avro-reload:jar:999-SNAPSHOT: Failed to resolve artifact io.quarkus:quarkus-integration-test-avro-reload:pom:999-SNAPSHOT: Could not find artifact io.quarkus:quarkus-integration-test-avro-reload:pom:999-SNAPSHOT -> [Help 1]
```
If I however run `./mvnw io.quarkus:quarkus-maven-plugin::go-offline -f integration-tests/avro-reload/` then the build is successful.

Here is the output of the first command including the `-X` option:
```
[ERROR] Failed to execute goal io.quarkus:quarkus-maven-plugin:999-SNAPSHOT:go-offline (default-cli) on project quarkus-integration-test-avro-reload: Failed to resolve Quarkus application model for io.quarkus:quarkus-integration-test-avro-reload:jar:999-SNAPSHOT: Failed to resolve artifact io.quarkus:quarkus-integration-test-avro-reload:pom:999-SNAPSHOT: Could not find artifact io.quarkus:quarkus-integration-test-avro-reload:pom:999-SNAPSHOT -> [Help 1]
```

### How to Reproduce?

Run `./mvnw io.quarkus:quarkus-maven-plugin::go-offline -f integration-tests/ -X` in Quarkus Git repo.

### Additional information

_No response_
